oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Warren Paint - 1946-02-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Warren Paint sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 16, 1946. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Lew Childre, Paul Howard and his Arkansas Cotton Pickers, Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, the Possum Hunters, Clyde Moody, the Bailey Brothers and the Happy Valley Boys, Howdy Forrester, and the Andrews Brothers. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lew Childre; Paul Howard; Arkansas Cotton Pickers; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Possum Hunters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: American Ace Coffee commercial (Grant Turner) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Grant Turner introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Lew Childre -- I'll Keep On Smiling (Lew Childre) -- George D. Hay introduces Paul Howard and his Arkansas Cotton Pickers -- Stay A Little Longer (Paul Howard and his Arkansas Cotton Pickers) -- George D. Hay and Lew Childre introduce Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Kentucky Waltz (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- Warren Paint commercial (Grant Turner) -- Greenback Dollar (Possum Hunters) -- George D. Hay introduces Lew Childre -- You Can't Break The Chains Of Love (Lew Childre)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Turner, Grant; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Howard, Paul, 1908-1984; Arkansas Cotton Pickers; Byrd, Billy; Moody, Clyde, 1915-1989; Possum Hunters (Musical group); Bailey Brothers; Happy Valley Boys; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Andrews Brothers
